author: namu sampath
text:
Listed as one of the state's busiest (and most dangerous) crash sites by @MassDOT, the intersection of the Cary, Lyman and Centre streets in Brockton is projected to see improvements starting spring 2024, the department announced Tuesday. 

More: https://t.co/5oxY9a89rN

author: namu sampath
text: friends, i got @verified today! that's all. :)

author: namu sampath
text:
.@MassDOT data shows there were 22 roadway deaths in Plymouth County last year — most of which were in Brockton — & the highest since pre-COVID.

Since 2018, 71 of the 1,485 deaths that have taken place statewide occurred in Plymouth County.

 [sub req]: https://t.co/KTTcpiYTWY

author: namu sampath
text:
My first for @enterprisenews — A Brockton man & Rhode Island woman were arrested in Virginia earlier this week following the fatal shooting of a Boston man, 24-year-old Brima Koroma, last month. 

Their arraignment hearing was yesterday. Story here: https://t.co/WCHWDkB1N5

author: namu sampath
text:
Some ✨news✨, I'll be covering Brockton, Mass. as a Public Safety Reporter for @enterprisenews, starting in April. 

Any tips, recs, and/or advice are welcome: nsampath@wickedlocal.com or my Twitter DMs. 

Very, very excited about this new journey! 🥳

author: namu sampath
text: My latest! https://t.co/6wlAxNInIl

author: namu sampath
text: I rode the spankin’ new #GLX train from Union Square to the Lechmere station this morning to catch a press conference about this historic milestone in Somerville’s history — which is decades in the making — directly connecting Somerville to Boston for @VilleJournal. https://t.co/MlDNWSB1im

author: namu sampath
text:
Happy #InternationalWomensDay! 

Each week this month, I’m featuring women in Somerville who are changing the status quo in their respective fields and absolutely killing it! 

Stay tuned for their stories on @VilleJournal.

author: namu sampath
text:
My latest for @VilleJournal. The deadliest intersection is in Somerville. Over the past two years alone, three people have died and numerous others have been injured. 

More on this intersection below: https://t.co/yBstF7p1Q1

author: namu sampath
text: also a very happy diwali! wishing you prosperity, wealth, peace and love 💗🪔✨

author: namu sampath
text:
Hi! If you grew up in an ethnic household (like me), I'm wondering if you celebrate Thanksgiving with any recipes from your background. 

💌 If you'd like to share any recipes, customs, or traditions you have, please email me at nsampath@wickedlocal.com for a story I'm writing.

author: namu sampath
text: As a longtime Boston resident and woman of color — I’m proud! https://t.co/vZ9MAdk3hF

author: namu sampath
text:
Finally, I’ve said this before and I’ll say this again, covering elections is no joke. 

P.S. if you followed along with my coverage today — thank you!

author: namu sampath
text:
The part two of this is: whew. 😮‍💨

What a whirlwind today was. Grateful I got to cover the city’s first mayoral election in nearly two decades — congrats @KatjBallantyne — & talk to so many constituents at the polls.

author: namu sampath
text:
A personal favorite for me today was speaking with two poll workers at the Albert F. Argenziano School in Ward 2. 

For these two, working the polls goes beyond getting paid for the job. More below ⬇️ https://t.co/CKnnsgvEBl

author: namu sampath
text:
Have you ever wondered about the people who hold signs for the candidates they support on #ElectionDay ? 

My latest for @VilleJournal on the elections today https://t.co/zdSFWcn4nI

author: namu sampath
text:
I’m covering the citywide elections in Somerville today! Check out my coverage so far on @VilleJournal or at https://t.co/QyyrMHMkRc

Exciting day! #mapoli #somerpoli https://t.co/xIbeytu4hh

author: namu sampath
text: shiney james told me i am “heartless” & often made me feel worthless when i worked for her in 2019. this article exposes so many of the truths i felt i was alone in dealing with. and as a former @dailyfreepress writer, i’m proud of student journalism. this article is incredible https://t.co/lvzkjOQpUu

author: namu sampath
text:
Covered the first election today of my career! It’s definitely no joke!

Follow my coverage on @VilleJournal 📰

Congrats again to the candidates who ran in the mayoral & city councilor elections. And, good luck to all the candidates running in November. 

#mapoli

author: namu sampath
text:
After his grandmother's death last winter, Elmer Martinez, a Somerville resident, has opened a multidisciplinary art gallery in his backyard.

“Everything is connected to the tragedies I have survived,” he said. 

My latest for @VilleJournal.

https://t.co/XM1I2A9DFq

author: namu sampath
text:
it makes me so happy & proud to see south asian women represented in media! it gives me hope for a future i only thought was possible in my wildest dreams as a kid. congrats, daisy! 

#WOCinJournalism https://t.co/RAfaVbeExk

author: namu sampath
text:
“Responses to the hunger crisis that were addressed during the pandemic will soon expire, and when they do, families will still be struggling.” 

My latest on the #hungercrisis in Massachusetts for @VilleJournal https://t.co/wnKGjf09xy

author: namu sampath
text:
The opioid crisis, exacerbated by #COVID19, hit a record of 93,000 deaths nationwide last year. 

Advocates of supervised drug consumption sites hope Somerville officials will make the investment to help people who use drugs. 

My latest for @VilleJournal: https://t.co/4CMdBT4ErG

author: namu sampath
text: If you currently live in the Greater Boston area and are looking for ways to volunteer in your community, orgs such as @foodforfreeorg, a non-profit combatting hunger, welcome your help! https://t.co/pXuESnGbrL

author: namu sampath
text: ✨UPDATE: I am now reporting for the @VilleJournal instead. Please send any and all tips related to Somerville, Mass. my way at nsampath@wickedlocal.com. Thank you!

author: namu sampath
text: Today's my first day covering Melrose (@MelroseFreePrss) & Medford (@medford_trans) for @USATODAY! If you have tips, story ideas or questions about either city you'd like to get answered, please don’t hesitate to get in touch: nsampath@wickedlocal.com

author: namu sampath
text:
graduated from @COMatBU yesterday! i couldn’t have done it without the endless support from my parents & the laughs and memories i’ve shared over the last four years with my friends 

onto the next great adventure!! ✌🏽 https://t.co/N9E6Aor9SB

author: namu sampath
text:
I'm extremely thankful I was able to intern, remotely, with @GBH. Nine months went by in the blink of an eye, but I will carry the experiences and memories with me for a lifetime! 

TL;DR: support your local news stations & don't be afraid to try new things!

author: namu sampath
text:
@GreaterBoston team + @jimbraude: y'all are amazing! I wish we could've interacted more, but I'm excited to continue following along on social media.

@RealSamFarrell I've enjoyed learning from you and hearing your advice. I'm so grateful you're my mentor!

author: namu sampath
text:
I've also made some really valuable relationships with my colleagues. Dare I say, friendships? 🙂

@christinabeiene thank you for helping me navigate through my first internship & for being so patient with me. I'm really going to miss our @SlackHQ convos.

author: namu sampath
text:
🧵Today marks my last day as an intern for @GreaterBoston at @GBH. 

These last nine months, I've edited videos for social media, researched & fact-checked for segments, and written professional copy on @SproutSocial, & learned about the inner workings of radio/tv journalism.

author: namu sampath
text:
🗞️ I wrote a commentary for @GBHNews about sexual assault on college campuses — a topic that is incredibly close to my heart — and why universities & state govts. should be doing more to help. 

Survivors shouldn't have to face their trauma alone. 

READ: https://t.co/VZCwtCoEoH

author: namu sampath
text: I never imagined I’d be finishing my last class of undergrad in my bedroom on Zoom on a random Thursday afternoon, but here we are! #Classof2021

author: namu sampath
text: It’s officially official! I have accepted a job @USATODAY as a Diversity & Social Justice Issues Reporter, specifically covering Medford and Melrose, Mass. I’m so grateful for this opportunity and I’m excited to stay in Boston for the foreseeable future! 🥳
